instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 stuck on boot
threads.message:
Hi there,

This board came in with no image on internal and external monitor. Resoldered U8900. Got an image but it get stuck on booting OS. Looks like when it tries to load Graphic card drivers. Please advice how to proceed.
pin 1 and 38 on U8900 are 3V.

Thanks!

threads.title: 820-3332 stuck on boot
threads.message: BIOS messed with? Will it boot EFI ASD?

threads.title: 820-3332 stuck on boot
threads.message:
Yes it boots to EFI ASD and all tests passed. However it gets stuck booting to OS ASD.
Here is new piece of information. My colleague actually replaced U8900 from a similar board because after resoldering the old one was no image. Could that be of a problem?

threads.title: 820-3332 stuck on boot
threads.message: If too much heat was added and GPU/VRAM got disturbed then yes! BIOS original???

threads.title: 820-3332 stuck on boot
threads.message: I am afraid thats exactly what happened because to my knowledge and customer claims nothing was previously done to bios. Will draw conclusions and make sure that doesnt happen again. Please close this threat.

threads.title: 820-3332 stuck on boot
threads.message: Reball GPU and VRAM and have fun removing the VRAM glue :(
